edu.luc.cs.trull
Class TerminatingComponent

java.lang.Object
  edu.luc.cs.trull.EmptyComponent
      edu.luc.cs.trull.TerminatingComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
Component, java.util.EventListener, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, PropertyChangeSource, SchedulerAware, Startable, Suspendable, Terminating
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractComponent, AbstractTaskWorker, ActionComponent, DefaultTaskWorker
public class TerminatingComponent
extends EmptyComponent
implements SchedulerAware

An abstract superclass for components that signal termination to their parents in the component tree. To indicate termination, subclasses should use scheduleTermination from within a lifecycle method or event listener method. To propagate termination upward directly, subclasses should use fireTermination from within their child termination listener.

Method Detail

fireTermination

protected void fireTermination()
Informs the termination listener that this component wants to terminate. Subclasses use this method to propagate termination events upward to parent components, usually in response to receiving a termination event from a child component. To preserve non-overlapping processing of events, this method must not be invoked from within an event listener method.

getParent

protected TerminationListener getParent()
Returns the parent of this component.

Returns:
the parent of this component.

protected Scheduler getScheduler()

getTermEvent

protected java.util.EventObject getTermEvent()
Returns the unique termination event for this component.

Returns:
the termination event.

scheduleTermination

public void scheduleTermination()
Schedules a request to the termination listener that this component wants to terminate. This method is used by subclasses. This method must be used when a component decides to terminate in response to an incoming event.
